results.title: Puffing Billy
results.brief_description: Newsreel item from 1954 about the steam train “Puffing Billy” making its journey from Ferntree Gully in the Dandenong Ranges in Victoria. At Ferntree Gully, the train is shown with hundreds of children on board. Shows people waving and taking photographs as the train leaves the station to wind its way through the countryside.
results.description: Newsreel item from 1954 about the steam train “Puffing Billy” making its journey from Ferntree Gully in the Dandenong Ranges in Victoria. results.title: Puffed out
results.creator_credit: Dennis Tupicoff, Dennis Tupicoff Animation and Victorian Film Corporation
results.brief_description: Aimed at the 8-12 year-olds, this film takes children down to the ashtray world of Bill and Betty, the cigarettes, then into their own world of running, dancing and surfing where, for the smoker, everything is just that little bit more difficult. Smoking slows reflexes, induces breathlessness and coughing. Voices by Ernie Bourne and Beverly Dunn and animation by Dennis Tupicoff.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Dennis Tupicoff, Dennis Tupicoff Animation and Victorian Film Corporation

results.title: Public relations
results.brief_description: Through the many changes in American life in the past twenty-five years, a new profession has come into being - the practice of public relations. Good public relations in business has become of prime importance and it is the public relations counsellor who is charged with the task of maintaining sound inter-relations of business, government, labour, and the public. This film discusses the advertising and other manifestations of this phase of modern business and presents some of the leaders in the field.

results.title: Public enemy number one
results.brief_description: Wilfred Burchett is Australia’s most controversial journalist. He has always been first on the spot, first with a good story, from Hiroshima to Hanoi. But his activities attracted the disfavour of the Australian Government and he was exiled from his own country for 17 years. Rated: G

results.title: Psychotic disorders: schizophrenia
results.creator_credit: Harry Ratner, Eve Cote and Coastline Community College
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Psychology: the study of human behavior”.
Schizophrenia is a psychotic disorder characterised by abnormalities of thought (strange beliefs, persecution complexes), abnormalities of perception (hallucinations, hearing voices) and speech abnormalities. The exact cause of schizophrenia is unknown, but it is thought to be in part a genetic predisposition and in part the result of environmental stress. This program surveys current research and theories on the causes and characteristics of schizophrenia.

results.title: Psychosexual differences. No. 2
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Social Psychology”.
Looks at the physiological and genetic origins of sexually differentiated behaviour. Jeffrey Grey talks about his research with rats and the kind of role reversals he can initiate by the manipulation of hormones.
